description: Mariam Elahmady, child of Dr. Ahmed Elahmady and Joelian Elahmady, plans to major in Pre-med Biology at Augustana College. Top 3 achievements: Student of the year in Honors U.S. History, IHSA Scholastic Achievement Award, and Student of the Month at Whiteside Area Career Center.
text:
Academics

Mariam Elahmady, child of Dr. Ahmed Elahmady and Joelian Elahmady, plans to
major in Pre-med Biology at Augustana College.

Top 3 achievements: Student of the year in Honors U.S. History, IHSA
Scholastic Achievement Award, and Student of the Month at Whiteside Area
Career Center

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school?
Throughout my high school experience, I have been subject to many activities
to further my education. This included countless projects, experiments, labs,
games, and other activities. The one class that sticks out as being the most
memorable is probably my sophomore year biology class. I was already invested
in the subject matter before the class even started due to my interest in
biology in regards to the medical field. As we all know biology can be a hard
concept to grasp due to its extensive involvement in life in general. The most
memorable activity in this class was when we got to dissect in the lab. How
living these are able to survive is a lot easier to understand when you see
them right in front of you rather than a diagram. Biology was probably one of
the hardest classes in my high school career, but also my most valuable.

The Arts

Alexis Bueno, child of Buddy and Stacy Bueno, plans to major in Nursing at
Aurora University, Aurora, Ill.

Top 3 accomplishments: National Choral Award, National Honors Society, and 1
Superior Rating at Solo Contest.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? I
will always remember the fun that was brought into learning during both band
and choir. My director always made it fun and made sure that there was fun
involved in learning and participating in class. He always had fun stories to
tell us and life lessons to reach us.

Humanities

Shelby Hodge, child of Steve and Melinda Hodge, plans to major in Elementary
Education at Kirkwood Community College.

Top 3 achievements: 3.75 GPA Academic Excellence Award, National Honor Society
Member, and Perfect Attendance

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school?
There have been many classroom learning experiences that have been impacting
and memorable. One that especially comes to mind was in my Honors English
class sophomore year. That year we started to read The Tempest by William
Shakespeare.

The Tempest was a new and different type of literature for our class. So, my
teacher had us act out the parts of the play. At first, our class was timid
about this new learning experience, but that quickly changed. Each student had
a character or would switch after so many lines. I especially remember playing
the part of Caliban and Trinculo.

On top of acting it out, we made character charts, answered questions, and
learned vocab. All of these ways helped my class understand The Tempest.
However, I believe acting it out impacted me the most. I'm very thankful for
my English teacher for this memorable classroom experience.

Leadership

Adelie Mure-Ravaud, child of Julie and Philippe Mure-Ravaud, plans to major in
Pre-health professional at Clinton Community College.

Top 3 achievements: Overall Steamer of the Month, 4-year Academic Excellence,
and International Thespian

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school?
One of my most memorable classroom experiences was making Hamlet themed
TikToks in my AP literature class. Our teacher gave us the opportunity to work
with our friends and use our creativity in the classroom. It allowed us to
combine our classwork with our out-of-school entertainment. The best part was
watching everyone's Hamlet version of popular TikToks.

Math/The Sciences

Sara Norman, child of Keith and Vicki Norman, plans to major in Architectural
Engineering at Olivet Nazarene University, Bourbonnais, Ill.

Top 3 achievements: Illinois State Scholar, President of Student Council, and
President of National Honor Society.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? I
decided to take a physics class during my junior year of high school. I
remembered hearing about all of the fun projects that were involved, and the
Six Flags trip at the end of the year was definitely a motivator for me to
join the class. However, I learned very quickly that designing and engineering
things were my dream. My most memorable learning experience was when we were
given the assignment to create a hoverboard. Racing across a gym while sitting
on a piece of floating wood and holding a leaf blower definitely tops any
other experience I had in school. Not only was it educational, but it was also
a fun competition. I will remember that physics class forever and am excited
to continue my education by doing something I love: creating and building new
things.

Vocational Education

Katie Grant, child of Sherrie and Chris Grant, will be enlisting in the U.S.
Army.

Top 3 achievements: Being asked to volunteer to paint murals at the elementary
school in Fulton, Student of the Month for Band, and being chosen for the end
of the year Art Award.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? My
favorite classroom learning experience is when we study for our history tests
playing a game like Jeopardy. It is a fun way to remember and study for your
test. You have to work as a team but you also need to know what you are doing
independently. I will remember this forever because there are moments when
your body is moving faster than your brain and you have no answer yet but you
buzzed in to answer anyway. Or when you have the answer on the tip of your
tongue but it just won't come out. The final jeopardy can make you win or lose
it all depending on if you are correct. I will always smile and laugh when I
remember the game.

title: Fulton High School
html:
Academics

Mariam Elahmady, child of Dr. Ahmed Elahmady and Joelian Elahmady, plans to major in Pre-med Biology at Augustana College.

Top 3 achievements: Student of the year in Honors U.S. History, IHSA Scholastic Achievement Award, and Student of the Month at Whiteside Area Career Center

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? Throughout my high school experience, I have been subject to many activities to further my education. This included countless projects, experiments, labs, games, and other activities. The one class that sticks out as being the most memorable is probably my sophomore year biology class. I was already invested in the subject matter before the class even started due to my interest in biology in regards to the medical field. As we all know biology can be a hard concept to grasp due to its extensive involvement in life in general. The most memorable activity in this class was when we got to dissect in the lab. How living these are able to survive is a lot easier to understand when you see them right in front of you rather than a diagram. Biology was probably one of the hardest classes in my high school career, but also my most valuable.

The Arts

Alexis Bueno, child of Buddy and Stacy Bueno, plans to major in Nursing at Aurora University, Aurora, Ill.

Top 3 accomplishments: National Choral Award, National Honors Society, and 1 Superior Rating at Solo Contest.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? I will always remember the fun that was brought into learning during both band and choir. My director always made it fun and made sure that there was fun involved in learning and participating in class. He always had fun stories to tell us and life lessons to reach us.

Humanities

Shelby Hodge, child of Steve and Melinda Hodge, plans to major in Elementary Education at Kirkwood Community College.

Top 3 achievements: 3.75 GPA Academic Excellence Award, National Honor Society Member, and Perfect Attendance

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? There have been many classroom learning experiences that have been impacting and memorable. One that especially comes to mind was in my Honors English class sophomore year. That year we started to read The Tempest by William Shakespeare.

The Tempest was a new and different type of literature for our class. So, my teacher had us act out the parts of the play. At first, our class was timid about this new learning experience, but that quickly changed. Each student had a character or would switch after so many lines. I especially remember playing the part of Caliban and Trinculo.

On top of acting it out, we made character charts, answered questions, and learned vocab. All of these ways helped my class understand The Tempest. However, I believe acting it out impacted me the most. I'm very thankful for my English teacher for this memorable classroom experience.

Top 3 achievements: Overall Steamer of the Month, 4-year Academic Excellence, and International Thespian

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? One of my most memorable classroom experiences was making Hamlet themed TikToks in my AP literature class. Our teacher gave us the opportunity to work with our friends and use our creativity in the classroom. It allowed us to combine our classwork with our out-of-school entertainment. The best part was watching everyone's Hamlet version of popular TikToks.

Math/The Sciences

Sara Norman, child of Keith and Vicki Norman, plans to major in Architectural Engineering at Olivet Nazarene University, Bourbonnais, Ill.

Top 3 achievements: Illinois State Scholar, President of Student Council, and President of National Honor Society.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? I decided to take a physics class during my junior year of high school. I remembered hearing about all of the fun projects that were involved, and the Six Flags trip at the end of the year was definitely a motivator for me to join the class. However, I learned very quickly that designing and engineering things were my dream. My most memorable learning experience was when we were given the assignment to create a hoverboard. Racing across a gym while sitting on a piece of floating wood and holding a leaf blower definitely tops any other experience I had in school. Not only was it educational, but it was also a fun competition. I will remember that physics class forever and am excited to continue my education by doing something I love: creating and building new things.

Top 3 achievements: Being asked to volunteer to paint murals at the elementary school in Fulton, Student of the Month for Band, and being chosen for the end of the year Art Award.

What's something you learned that you will take with you after high school? My favorite classroom learning experience is when we study for our history tests playing a game like Jeopardy. It is a fun way to remember and study for your test. You have to work as a team but you also need to know what you are doing independently. I will remember this forever because there are moments when your body is moving faster than your brain and you have no answer yet but you buzzed in to answer anyway. Or when you have the answer on the tip of your tongue but it just won't come out. The final jeopardy can make you win or lose it all depending on if you are correct. I will always smile and laugh when I remember the game.
